Description: A fragment of a natural and dark brown, wool textile used as a wrapping. The weave is plain. The spinning direction of warp and weft is 's'. The thread count is warp 6 per 10mm and weft 18 per 10mm (the thread count has 4 warp fibres/10mm and 7-10mm). A rough seam, sewn with light blue wool thread, is present. The sewing thread is loosely plied and consists of 2 's'-spun elements, 'z'-plied.
Dimensions: Height: 5 millimetres (taken at the raised seam)
Bibliographic references: Adams et al 1999 / Kulubnarti III: The Cemeteries (p. 62)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Dr William Yewdale Adams
Donated by: W S Webb Museum of Anthropology (University of Kentucky)
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: 93.2.16B (excavation object cat. no.)
